title: Jamaica, Haiti and Cuba take stock after Hurricane Melissa destruction
summary: Recovery efforts are under way across Jamaica after Melissa rips off roofs, cuts electricity and unleashes floodwaters.

title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across northern Caribbean
summary: Hurricane warnings persist as Melissa nears Bermuda, with potential for strengthening before eventual weakening.

title: Austin Reaves, Lakers beat Timberwolves at the buzzer
summary: The LA Lakers guard continues his hot start to the NBA season with a 12ft game-winner against Minnesota Timberwolves.

title: Netherlands centrist party wins big in election as far right loses support
summary: The centre-left D66 has made its largest ever gains and almost tripled its seats in parliament.

title: Trump says US to resume nuclear weapons tests, backs S Korean nuclear sub
summary: Trump orders US Defense Department to 'immediately' resume nuclear weapons testing on 'equal basis' with other powers.

title: LIVE: Palestinians lose hope in ceasefire after Israeli strike wave on Gaza
summary: Mediators insist truce is strong after Israel kills over 100 people, mostly children, before 'returning' to ceasefire.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,344
summary: Here are the key events from day 1,344 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Yesavage, Blue Jays dominate Dodgers in Game 5 of World Series
summary: Toronto Blue Jays' Trey Yesavage sets World Series rookie record for strikeouts against LA Dodgers to forge 3-2 lead.

title: Guerre à Gaza : un cycle sans fin ?
summary: Plus de 100 personnes sont mortes dans des bombardements israéliens, selon la Défense civile de Gaza. Alors que le Hamas et l’État hébreu s’accusent toujours mutuellement d’avoir violé la trêve, Israël a annoncé « reprendre le cessez-le-feu » après ces violentes frappes. De son côté, le président américain Donald Trump a assuré que « rien » ne compromettrait l’accord de paix qu’il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas.

title: Gaza : Israël dit reprendre le cessez-le-feu après des frappes ayant fait plus de 100 morts
summary: La Défense civile et les hôpitaux de Gaza ont annoncé mercredi la mort de plus de cent personnes, dont de nombreux enfants, dans des bombardements israéliens. Israël a dit "reprendre le cessez-le-feu" après ces frappes. Malgré ces violences, le président Donald Trump a assuré que "rien" ne compromettrait l'accord de cessez-le-feu qu'il a négocié entre Israël et le Hamas. Retrouvez le fil de la journée du 29 octobre.

title: Israël lance des frappes sur Gaza, le Hamas dément toute attaque sur les troupes israéliennes
summary: Israël a mené des frappes meurtrières dans la bande de Gaza, mardi, entrainant la mort d'au moins 30 personnes, selon La Défense civile opérant sous l'autorité du Hamas. Plus tôt, Benjamin Netanyahu a accusé le Hamas de violer la trêve. Ce dernier dément toute attaque sur des soldats israéliens et "réaffirme son engagement envers l'accord de cessez-le-feu".

title: Gaza : la dernière restitution de dépouille d'otage met le cessez-le-feu en péril, selon Israël
summary: Au lendemain de la restitution par le Hamas d'une dépouille d'otage israélien, Israël affirme mardi que ces "restes humains" appartiennent déjà à un corps d'otage rendu. Et accuse le groupe islamiste palestinien de violation de leur accord de cessez-le-feu dans la bande de Gaza.

title: Liban : l'ONU et la France dénoncent des tirs israéliens près de Casques bleus de la Finul
summary: L'ONU et la France affirment qu'un drone israélien a largué, dimanche au Liban, une grenade à proximité d'une patrouille de la Finul. Elles accusent également un char israélien d'avoir tiré sur des Casques bleus. Israël explique avoir riposté après que les forces de la Finul ont abattu un de ses drones de renseignement.

title: Liban : désarmement du Hezbollah, frappes israéliennes et drones
summary: Serge Berberi, notre correspondant à Beyrouth, analyse la situation.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne annonce avoir reçu un cercueil contenant le corps d'un seizième otage
summary: Le bureau du Premier ministre israélien a affirmé, lundi soir, que le Hamas a restitué le corps d'un seizième otage mort dans la bande de Gaza. Quelques heures auparavant, les familles des otages avaient appelé à suspendre les prochaines étapes de l'accord de cessez-le-feu si toutes les dépouilles n'étaient pas rendues.

title: Gaza : la Croix-Rouge, le Hamas et une équipe égyptienne cherchent des corps d'otages, selon Israël
summary: La Croix-Rouge, une personne du Hamas et une équipe égyptienne participent lundi à des recherches pour retrouver des dépouilles d'otages détenus depuis l'attaque du 7 octobre 2023 dans la bande de Gaza. Autorisées à pénétrer "au-delà de la "ligne jaune", les équipes de recherche agissent "sous la supervision étroite de l'armée israélienne", selon la porte-parole du gouvernement israélien.

title: Guerre à Gaza : quelle force de stabilisation ?
summary: Claire Duhamel, correspondante France24 à Jérusalem, décrypte la situation.

title: Karin Huster : "Gaza, un summum de destruction unique dans l'expérience de beaucoup d'humanitaires"
summary: Deux semaines après la mise en œuvre du cessez-le-feu à Gaza, l'aide humanitaire qui entre dans l'enclave est toujours insuffisante au regard de l'ampleur des besoins et alors qu'une grande partie de la population a été touchée par la famine. Outre les 68 000 morts, près de 170 000 personnes ont été blessées ; parmi elles, 15 000 ont besoin d'être évacuées d'urgence selon l'OMS. Témoignage depuis al-Mawasi de Karin Huster, responsable des activités médicales de Médecins sans frontières.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne affirme avoir mené une frappe aérienne contre le Jihad islamique
summary: L'armée israélienne a indiqué, samedi soir, avoir mené une frappe aérienne dans le centre de la bande de Gaza en dépit du cessez-le-feu en vigueur. Elle visait, selon elle, un membre du Jihad islamique.

title: En Israël, Netanyahu va-t-il faire le pari d’une élection anticipée ?
summary: Porté par l’onde de choc de la libération des otages, du cessez-le-feu à Gaza et de la visite triomphale de Donald Trump à Jérusalem, Benjamin Netanyahu va-t-il convoquer des législatives anticipées ? Nombre d’observateurs de la vie politique israélienne penchent en faveur de ce scenario. Le Premier ministre tentera-t-il un ultime coup de poker pour rester au pouvoir ?

title: Après la rencontre entre Xi Jinping et Donald Trump, une accalmie provisoire dans l’escalade entre les deux puissances
summary: Pour la première fois depuis 2019, les présidents américain et chinois se sont retrouvés en Corée du Sud dans un contexte marqué par la menace d’une reprise des essais nucléaires américains. Cette rencontre est marquée par la suspension des mesures protectionnistes les plus dures et des accords sur les droits de douane, les terres rares, le soja et le fentanyl.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : un mort et plusieurs blessés lors de bombardements russes dans les oblasts de Zaporijia et Kiev, selon les autorités locales
summary: Treize personnes, dont six enfants, ont été blessées dans une attaque de missiles et de drones russes à Zaporijia, a fait savoir jeudi matin le gouverneur de l’oblast. Depuis la Corée du Sud, Donald Trump a assuré que les Etats-Unis et la Chine vont « travailler ensemble » sur le conflit pour « obtenir quelque chose ».

title: L’ouragan Melissa cause la mort de plus de 30 personnes, selon un bilan provisoire
summary: C’est en Haïti que le nombre de victimes est le plus important. Le cyclone reste dangereux, et le bilan pourrait s’alourdir, à mesure que la Jamaïque et Cuba vont redevenir accessibles.

title: Donald Trump annonce avoir conclu un accord sur les terres rares lors de sa rencontre avec Xi Jinping
summary: La Chine a confirmé avoir accepté de suspendre pendant un an les restrictions à l’exportation de ces minerais indispensables aux nouvelles technologies comme à l’industrie de défense. Les droits de douane appliqués aux produits chinois vont être ramenés de 20 % à 10 %.

title: Cécile Van de Velde, sociologue : « La colère de la génération Z n’est pas idéologique mais pragmatique »
summary: Dans un entretien au « Monde », la spécialiste de la jeunesse décrypte les mouvements de contestation portés depuis le début de l’automne par la jeunesse du Maroc, de Madagascar, du Népal et du Pérou, entre autres.

title: Aux Etats-Unis, le Maine, théâtre du fossé générationnel entre nouvelle et ancienne garde démocrate
summary: Ancien militaire devenu ostréiculteur, Graham Platner, 41 ans, bouscule le scénario préparé par la direction du Parti démocrate pour les sénatoriales de 2026, qui lui préfère Janet Mills, 77 ans, plus rompue à la politique mais moins populaire sur le terrain.

title: Elections législatives aux Pays-Bas : l’extrême droite et le centre à égalité, après le dépouillement de 95 % des bulletins de vote
summary: Donné dans un premier temps battu, le PVV de Geert Wilders fait désormais jeu égal avec le parti centriste pro-européen D66. Selon les projections, les deux formations recueilleraient 26 sièges chacun, mais le jeune leader centriste Rob Jetten semble davantage en mesure de former une coalition.

title: « Donald Trump est en guerre contre une partie de son pays, celle qui ne pense pas comme lui »
summary: Alors que, depuis sa réélection il y a un an, le président des Etats-Unis s’emploie à faire la paix à l’étranger, il entretient le chaos à domicile, se servant de sa fonction pour se venger, analyse dans sa chronique Alain Frachon, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Les Etats-Unis mènent une nouvelle frappe dans l’océan Pacifique contre un bateau supposément lié au narcotrafic
summary: « Quatre narcoterroristes » ont été tués, a affirmé le secrétaire américain de la défense, Pete Hegseth, assurant que le navire visé était connu pour être lié au trafic de drogue. Sous pression, le Venezuela a annoncé, de son côté, avoir intercepté trois avions et détruit deux camps de narcotrafiquants.

title: Donald Trump ordonne la reprise immédiate des essais d’armes nucléaires aux Etats-Unis
summary: Le président américain a demandé, jeudi, au ministère de la défense de « commencer à tester » les armes atomiques. Cette déclaration survient alors que la Russie a annoncé, mercredi, avoir testé un drone sous-marin à capacité nucléaire.

title: En Indonésie, le programme de repas gratuits tourne à l’indigestion
summary: L’initiative, portée par la présidence depuis le début de l’année pour remédier aux retards de croissance des écoliers, tourne au fiasco. Des milliers d’élèves et d’étudiants ont été victimes d’intoxication alimentaire. Les plaintes ne cessent d’affluer.

title: A quelques jours de l’ouverture de la COP30, Donald Trump prétend « avoir gagné la guerre contre le canular du changement climatique »
summary: Le président de Etats-Unis, connu pour ses positions climatosceptiques, a réagi sur son réseau Truth Social à un communiqué du milliardaire Bill Gates qui estimait que le réchauffement n’allait « pas conduire à la disparition de l’humanité ». La conférence de l’ONU se tiendra les 6 et 7 novembre au Brésil.

title: Netanyahu visits US command centre amid deadly Israeli strikes
summary:
Netanyahu visits US command centre amid deadly Israeli strikes

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visited the US-led headquarters of the multinational force in Kiryat Gat, overseeing the Gaza ceasefire on Wednesday, his office announced.

Anadolu news agency reported that Netanyahu also met with US Central Command (Centcom) Commander Admiral Bradley Cooper.

The visit comes after the Israeli army killed more than 110 Palestinians, including 46 children, in Gaza since Tuesday.

Israeli attacks also wounded 253 people, including 78 children and 84 women, according to the Palestinian health ministry.

title: Palestinian commission says Israel set up nearly 1,000 barriers across West Bank
summary:
Palestinian commission says Israel set up nearly 1,000 barriers across West Bank

Israel has erected nearly 1,000 barriers in cities and towns in the occupied West Bank, Al Jazeera reported.

Among the new barriers are metal gates stationed at many village and town entrances, the report said. 

As per the Colonization and Wall Resistance Commission, an official Palestinian governmental body, 916 gates, barriers and walls have been installed since October 2023.

title: Israeli soldiers enter Lebanon town, kill municipal employee, local media reports
summary:
Israeli soldiers enter Lebanon town, kill municipal employee, local media reports

Israeli soldiers on Thursday raided the southern Lebanese town of Blida and killed a municipal employee, local media have reported. 

Israeli troops entered the town of Blida after midnight with several military vehicles and stormed the municipal building, as per the official National News Agency.  

At the municipality, Israeli soldiers killed Ibrahim Salameh, an employee who had been staying there, the report said. 

The soldiers withdrew before dawn and the Lebanese army later entered the building and recovered the body of the municipal worker, NNA adds. 

Times of Israel reported that the army has not yet made any comments on the incident. 

من مكان تصفية موظف بلدية بليدا الشهيد ابراهيم سلامة على ايدي قوة من الإحتلال التي توغلت فجر اليوم الى مركز البلدية بعمق اكثر من الف متر داخل الأراضي اللبنانية. pic.twitter.com/z5BZzjKcGl

— Ahmad Hamieh🇦🇷🇦🇷 (@Ahmadhamieh313) October 30, 2025

title: Israeli forces storm neighbourhoods in West Bank, arrest 18
summary:
Israeli forces storm neighbourhoods in West Bank, arrest 18

Israeli forces and settlers on Thursday stormed the Al-Hathroura community east of Jerusalem, where soldiers arrested 18 young men, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, quoting the Jerusalem Governorate. 

Israeli forces also stormed the city of Halhul, north of Hebron and the Aida refugee camp north of Bethlehem in the West Bank

Palestinian media reported that the Israeli forces opened fire on young men during a raid in the vicinity of the academy in the Rafidia neighbourhood, west of Nablus.

A Palestinian man was wounded by Israeli army gunfire during a raid in the vicinity of An-Najah National University in Nablus, in the northern West Bank.

title: Doctors Without Borders: Israel continues to use aid as weapon of war
summary:
Doctors Without Borders: Israel continues to use aid as weapon of war

Doctors Without Borders project coordinator in Gaza, Caroline Willeman, on Thursday said that Israel continues to use aid as a weapon of war against Gaza.

Willeman said that the humanitarian situation in the region has not improved much, as shortages of water and shelter persist.

The Medical Relief Society in Gaza said the health system is collapsing beyond repair, warning that almost half of all kidney patients in the territory have already died because of Israel's blockade.

title: Israeli strikes hit Khan Younis despite ceasefire pledge, two killed
summary:
Israeli strikes hit Khan Younis despite ceasefire pledge, two killed

Israeli forces on Thursday launched more than 10 air strikes targeting the eastern areas of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip, local media have reported. 

Reports said that at least two Palestinians were killed in Gaza despite the Israeli army's announcement that it was returning to implementing the ceasefire agreement. 

Palestinian media also reported that the Israeli army demolished residential homes in the eastern areas of Gaza City.

title: France has sent military personnel to Israel to 'implement peace plan', minister says
summary:
France has sent military personnel to Israel to 'implement peace plan', minister says

French foreign minister on Wednesday said that the country has sent civilians and military personnel to Israel to participate in a coordination centre set up by the US to organise the post-war Gaza, news agency AFP reported. 

"We have dispatched French military and civilian personnel to the team that the United States has deployed in Israel to implement the peace plan," said Jean-Noël Barrot, during an interview on the LCI channel, specifying that this centre was located "between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv."

The minister did not specify the number of personnel deployed, but they have already arrived on site, according to a source close to the minister interviewed by AFP.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Israel's war on Gaza, now in its 754th day:

  • Israeli forces launched 10 air strikes on the eastern areas of Khan Younis city at dawn today, where the army carried out massive demolition operations.

  • United Nations has strongly condemned the killings resulting from Israeli air strikes in Gaza. Over the past 24 hours, Israel has killed at least 110 Palestinians, including 35 children. 

  • Reports said that at least two Palestinians were killed in Gaza despite the Israeli army's announcement that it was returning to implementing the ceasefire agreement.

  • The director of the Medical Relief Society in Gaza said that they have lost 40% of kidney patients and that 350,000 diabetic patients in Gaza have not received any follow-up. 

  • Doctors Without Borders said that Israel continues to use aid as a weapon of war against Gaza. 

  • France has said it has sent a team to Israel to participate in the US plan to organise the post-war phase in the Gaza Strip.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

- Israeli air strikes targeted parts of Khan Younis in southern Gaza late Wednesday night into Thursday, following Israel's announcement to resume adherence to the ceasefire agreement. In the 24 hours prior, Israeli air strikes killed more than 110 Palestinians across Gaza.

- In a statement released on Wednesday, the security forces of Hamas's military wing warned Palestinians in Gaza to "strictly adhere to personal security measures, especially regarding movement and travel, and to avoid any laxity in the use of phones and the internet, given their key role in monitoring and tracking resistance fighters".

- After Israeli forces published an infographic on X listing 25 names of assassinated "terrorist" targets in Gaza over the last 24 hours, the Gaza media office said that the tactic is "media manipulation" because many of the names are false. 

- The Medical Relief Society in Gaza says the health system is collapsing beyond repair, warning that almost half of all kidney patients in the enclave have already died.

- Qatar's prime minister said Hamas will not be part of the future governance of Gaza, but the group has not yet committed to unconditional disarmament.

- Mohannad Karajah, a Palestinian human rights lawyer in the occupied West Bank, has been arrested by Palestinian Authority (PA) security forces after being the target of what rights groups have called a smear campaign.

title: Israel bombs Khan Younis in southern Gaza
summary:
Israel bombs Khan Younis in southern Gaza

Israeli air strikes targeted parts of Khan Younis in southern Gaza late Wednesday night into Thursday, local reports said. 

This follows Israel's announcement to resume adherence to the ceasefire agreement, after killing more than 110 Palestinians over the last 24 hours.

title: Ireland condemns Israeli strikes on Gaza
summary:
Ireland condemns Israeli strikes on Gaza

Ireland's Taoiseach Micheál Martin late on Wednesday said he "strongly" condemns Israel's strikes in Gaza that left more than 100 dead.

"I urge all parties to adhere to, and implement, the ceasefire agreement and call for a surge in humanitarian aid to the people of Gaza. The latest loss of so many innocent lives, including dozens of children, is absolutely appalling," Martin said in a statement posted to X.

"International law must be respected. All parties need to honour the commitments they made and to work to ensure that the other elements of the plan can move forward. Too many people have suffered and died already".

title: Overwhelming majority of Palestinians oppose Hamas disarmament, poll finds
summary:
Overwhelming majority of Palestinians oppose Hamas disarmament, poll finds

An overwhelming majority of Palestinians are opposed to Hamas's disarmament and are deeply sceptical that US President Donald Trump’s peace plan will lead to a permanent end to Israel’s war on Gaza.

About 70 percent of Palestinians polled across the occupied West Bank and Gazasay they staunchly oppose the disarmament of Hamas, even if that means a return to Israeli attacks, according to a poll conducted by the Palestinian Centre for Policy and Survey Research (PCPSR) between 22-25 October and published on Tuesday. 

Notably, opposition to the disarmament of Hamas is strongest in the occupied West Bank, where around 80 percent of respondents said they want the group’s armed wing to maintain its weapons. The occupied West Bank is governed by the Palestinian Authority (PA), which is dominated by Hamas’s secular rival, Fatah.

Read more: Overwhelming majority of Palestinians oppose Hamas disarmament, poll finds

title: Parliament speaker criticizes West's empty peace rhetoric
summary: Bojnourd, IRNA – Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf has criticized the contradictory behavior of Iran’s adversaries, who promote peace while preparing for military aggression.

title: Iran, Turkey vow to deepen mutual ties in high-level talks
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Interior Minister Eskandar Momeni says there are no limitations to expanding bilateral relations and mutual visits can significantly contribute to enhancing ties.

title: Iranian girls futsal team wins Asian Youth Games title in Bahrain
summary: Tehran, IRNA - The Iranian girls' futsal team has secured the championship title at the Asian Youth Games in Bahrain after a penalty shootout victory.

title: Iran, Indonesia determined to boost bilateral cooperation: Baghaei
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei says both Iran and Indonesia are ready to enhance their bilateral cooperation in all areas of mutual interest.

title: 104 killed in overnight Israeli attacks in Gaza despite ceasefire
summary: Tehran, IRNA – As many as 104 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli strikes over the past 24 hours, the Gaza health ministry said on Wednesday, condemning Tel Aviv for its repeated violations of the ceasefire.

title: Iran and Afghanistan to continue talks over shared water resources: Deputy FM
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabad says Iran will continue to pursue issues related to shared water resources and transboundary rivers, in a special way, with Afghanistan.

title: Hamas calls on ceasefire mediators to pressure Israel to halt its "military extremism"
summary: Tehran, IRNA - The Palestinian Islamic Resistance Movement, Hamas, has once again denounced the Israeli violation of the Gaza ceasefire agreement, calling on the mediators to accept their responsibility for the Tel Aviv regime’s "military extremism."

title: Foreign Minister Araghchi congratulates Turkey on Republic Day
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has congratulated his Turkish counterpart Hakan Fidan on Tuesday on the occasion of Turkey’s Republic Day, expressing hope for deeper cooperation between the neighboring countries.

title: Pezeshkian congratulates Turkish president on National Day, calls for enhanced ties
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian has sent a message to his Turkish counterpart, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, to congratulate him and the Turkish nation on the National Day of the Republic of Turkey.

title: Pezeshkian honors healthcare staff’s sacrifices during 12-day war
summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian has expressed gratitude for the sacrifices and efforts of the medical community throughout the 12-day war, particularly praising the dedicated nurses.

title: Telecom minister underlines resumption of Iran-Indonesia joint economic commission
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran's Minister of Communications and Information Technology Sattar Hashemi has stressed resumption of Iran-Indonesia Joint Economic Commission’s activities.

title: Tehran, Islamabad discuss deepening bilateral cooperation
summary: Tehran, IRNA— Senior officials from Iran and Pakistan have met in Tehran, focusing on plans to significantly strengthen bilateral cooperation across political, economic, and security sectors.

title: US, South Korea sign trade deal
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump signed another deal on his swing through Asia, this time with South Korea's leader Lee Jae-myung.

title: 9th day of Asian Youth Games 2025
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – The Iranian sports caravan, titled "Ambassadors of Hope," is participating in the third Asian Youth Games (AYG) in Bahrain with the attendance of 236 athletes in 22 fields.

title: Over 460 people reportedly found slain in hospital in Sudan
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – More than 460 patients and companions were reportedly found slain in a maternity hospital amid reports of continued atrocities against civilians in Sudan's El Fasher, UN humanitarians said Wednesday.

title: Trump announces tariff reductions on China after meeting Xi
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – The US President has announced that he has agreed to reduce tariffs imposed on Beijing in exchange for China's continued exports of rare earth minerals and combating the illegal trade in fentanyl.

title: Iran emphasizes developing relations with Afghanistan: min.
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – Iran’s Interior Minister Eskandar Momeni stressed the need to expand and develop relations with Afghanistan.

title: Front pages of Iran’s English dailies on October 30
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran’s English language dailies on Thursday, October 30.

title: Iran to neither surrender nor accept captivity: Ghalibaf
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 30 (MNA) – Iran’s parliament speaker says the Israeli regime is after subjecting its targeted nations to either imposed warfare or deceptive peace, asserting, however, that the Islamic Republic of Iran will not yield to surrender.

title: Iran, Indonesia resolved to boost bilateral cooperation
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei says both Iran and Indonesia are ready to enhance their bilateral cooperation in all areas of mutual interest.

title: Iran strongly condemns Zionist regime's airstrikes on Gaza
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei has strongly condemned the Zionist Israeli regime's breach of the ceasefire with the Hamas movement in resuming airstrikes on the Gaza Strip.

title: Iranian girls volleyball team win 2025 AYG title
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Iran’s girls volleyball team defeated Indonesia 3-2 (28-26, 20-25, 18-25, 25-17, 16-14) in the final of the 2025 Asian Youth Games (AYG) on Wednesday.

title: Iran sees no limits to developing relations with Turkey
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Iranian Interior Minister Eskandar Mo’meni says that his country is eager to expand relations with neighboring Turkey and sees no limits to developing such ties.

title: Netherlands heads to polls for knife-edge parl. elections
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 29 (MNA) – Polling stations opened across the Netherlands on Wednesday morning as the country votes to elect members of the House of Representatives, with polls showing a tight race among the leading parties.

title: مدال برنز بختیاری قطعی شد
summary: ملی پوش تکواندو کشورمان با برتری مقابل حریف خود در مرحله یک چهارم نهایی کسب مدال برنز در رقابت های جهانی را قطعی کرد.

title: افتتاح ۶ بازار میوه و تره بار جدید در تهران
summary: در یکصد و نود و یکمین پویش امید و افتخار ۶ بازار میوه‌ و تره‌بار در نقاط مختلف پایتخت به بهره‌برداری می‌رسد.

title: امام جمعه خارگ: ترویج فرهنگ قرآنی باید از مدارس و ادارات آغاز شود
summary: خارگ – امام جمعه و رئیس شورای قرآنی بخش ویژه خارگ گفت: ترویج و نهادینه‌سازی فرهنگ قرآنی باید از مدارس و ادارات آغاز شود تا آموزه‌های الهی در زندگی روزمره مردم جاری شود.

title: مظفر: کار مجمع تشخیص مصلحت نظام نه مچ‌گیری بلکه راه‌گشایی است
summary: عضو مجمع تشخیص مصلحت نظام با اشاره به اینکه ما اساساً در عملکرد دستگاه‌ها دخالت نداریم، گفت: کار مجمع تشخیص مصلحت نظام نه مچ‌گیری بلکه راه‌گشایی است.

title: وضعیت جوی و دریایی استان بوشهر تا روز شنبه آرام است
summary: بوشهر- کارشناس اداره‌کل هواشناسی استان بوشهر گفت:وضعیت جوی و دریایی نسبتاً آرامی تا روز شنبه بر استان حاکم است .

title: مرادی: خیران مدرسه‌ساز معماران امید و آینده در هرمزگان هستند
summary: بندرعباس- نماینده مردم هرمزگان در مجلس با تقدیر از تلاش‌های نیکوکاران عرصه آموزش، گفت: خیران مدرسه‌ساز معماران واقعی آینده‌ هستند.
